output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in linear algebra, equipping you with the tools to solve complex problems in various fields. Further exploration of advanced topics and applications is highly encouraged.
output.introduction: Welcome to Linear Algebra! This course provides an intermediate-level introduction to the fundamental concepts and techniques of linear algebra. We will explore vector spaces, linear transformations, eigenvalues, and more. Each module is designed for approximately 5 minutes of reading.

chapters.description: Introduction to vectors in n-dimensional space. Definition of vector spaces and subspaces. Examples of vector spaces.
Linear combinations of vectors. Span of a set of vectors. Determining if a vector is in the span of a set.
Definition of linear independence and dependence. Methods for determining linear independence.
Introduction to matrices. Matrix addition, scalar multiplication, and matrix multiplication.
Identity matrix, zero matrix, diagonal matrix, triangular matrices.
Definition and properties of the transpose of a matrix.
Introduction to systems of linear equations. Representing systems as matrices.
Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination and row echelon form.
Reduced row echelon form and Gauss-Jordan elimination.
Definition and properties of determinants. Calculating determinants using cofactor expansion.
Using determinants to determine if a matrix is invertible.
Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule.
Introduction to linear transformations. Definition and examples.
Kernel (null space) and range (image) of a linear transformation.
Definition of eigenvalues and eigenvectors. Finding eigenvalues by solving the characteristic equation.
Diagonalizing matrices using eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
